Yes, there are initiatives and regulations in place to address the environmental impacts of mining in South America. For example, some governments have implemented environmental impact assessments and regulations on mining operations. There are also non-governmental organizations that work to hold mining companies accountable for their environmental practices and advocate for sustainable and responsible mining practices. 

Additionally, some mining companies are implementing environmental management systems, such as reforestation and water treatment programs, to mitigate the negative impacts of mining. The adoption of innovative technologies in mining, such as cleaner mining technologies and carbon capture, utilization and storage (CCUS) is also expected to reduce the environmental impact of mining in South America.

Lastly, citizens and local communities are engaging in activism, campaigning, and advocacy to protect their environment and their rights.
